title: Tate Modern "Rings of Saturn" chunky rounded font
content:
Does anyone know the name of this font, or the name of the font it is based on?

Cheers

S

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [font.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20120104180023/http:/typophile.com/files/font_29.gif) | 44.12 KB |
author: Flynner

comments.content:
I think I've seen this before, but the name escapes me. You might want to check out Gusto by Rian Hughes.

- Lex
What is the source of this sample?

Hmm, i might be wrong here, but this looks a lot like TH AlphabetSoup with an added stroke.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20120104180023im_/http:/typophile.com/files/alphabet_4137.png)

not a perfect match, but very similar  
 [http://www.neubauladen.com/catalogue/NB-Typography/3/NBFett%E2%84%A2/1044/1](http://web.archive.org/web/20120104180023/http:/www.neubauladen.com/catalogue/NB-Typography/3/NBFett%E2%84%A2/1044/1 "http://www.neubauladen.com/catalogue/NB-Typography/3/NBFett%E2%84%A2/1044/1")

I think Seb is on the right track. It looks to me like a rounded sans, like VAG, Vega, Arial Rounded, Frankfurter, etc. that has had enough stroke thickness added to close out the counters.

- Mike Yanega
It was custom made by those cool cats at [www.non-format.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20120104180023/http:/www.non-format.com/ "www.non-format.com")

Thanks for the help guys. As it seems to be a custom font I might go for that Neubauladen version.

Cheers

S
